title: Congratulating Kevin McGoff upon the occasion of his designation as recipient of the 2010 George Shiebler Award by the Eastern College Athletic Conference
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION congratulating Kevin McGoff upon the occasion of
his designation as recipient of the 2010 George Shiebler  Award  by  the
Eastern College Athletic Conference

WHEREAS,  It is the custom of this Legislative Body to recognize and pay
tribute to those exemplary officiators who have distinguished themselves
through  their   outstanding   commitment,   and   who   have   attained
unprecedented success within their profession; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to  congratu-
late  Kevin  McGoff upon the occasion of his designation as recipient of
the 2010 George Shiebler Award by the Eastern College  Athletic  Confer-
ence (ECAC); and
  WHEREAS,  This  prestigious award will be presented to Kevin McGoff at
the ECAC Honors Banquet Luncheon at the Resort and Conference Center  at
Hyannis,  Massachusetts,  during the ECAC Fall Convention and Trade Show
held on Tuesday, September 28, 2010; and
  WHEREAS, The nation's largest athletic and the  only  multi-divisional
conference  in the country, the ECAC, a non-profit service organization,
established in 1938, stretches from Maine to North Carolina and westerly
to Illinois; and
  WHEREAS, The George L. Shiebler Award is presented annually to an ECAC
official who has demonstrated dedication to his  vocational  activities;
this  honor is named after George L. Shiebler, a former ECAC commission-
er, in recognition of his outstanding leadership over the many years  he
was associated with Eastern collegiate athletics; and
  WHEREAS,  An  exceptional basketball and soccer official for more than
35 years, Kevin McGoff has also served as an ECAC  soccer  assignor  for
the  past 18 years; his responsibilities include recording schedules and
assigning officials for 65 men's and women's  teams,  3000  assignments,
and over 300 officials per year; and
  WHEREAS, His extraordinary basketball officiating career began in 1972
and  since  then, Kevin McGoff has worked at the Division I, II, and III
levels; furthermore, he has officiated games for  the  Atlantic-10,  Ivy
League,  Patriot  League,  and  America East at the Division I level and
Northeast-10 and  State  University  of  New  York  Athletic  Conference
(SUNYAC)  at  the  Division  II  and  III  levels in both basketball and
soccer; and
  WHEREAS, His soccer officiating career is extensive as well as impres-
sive; he has officiated for the Big East, as well as many other leagues;
moreover, he has worked both the Big East and the Patriot League Champi-
onships; and
  WHEREAS, At the Division II and Division III levels, Kevin McGoff  has
been  employed  by  the  Northeast-10  and SUNYAC, and has officiated 10
SUNYAC Championship games as well as worked the NCAA Division II  Finals
in both 1999 and 2003; and
  WHEREAS, Furthermore, Kevin McGoff has worked at the high school level
for  many  years  in basketball and soccer; he officiated three New York
State High School Basketball Finals, was a high school  Soccer  official
for  more  than  30  years, and officiated 10 New York State High School
Soccer Finals; and
  WHEREAS, During his career, Kevin  McGoff  was  loyally  and  enthusi-
astically supported by family, fans, friends and the community at large;
and
  WHEREAS,  It is the sense of this Legislative Body that those individ-
uals who have shown a long and sustained commitment to  the  maintenance
of  high standards in their profession, certainly have earned the recog-

nition and applause of all the citizens of this great Empire State; now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
congratulate Kevin McGoff upon the occasion of his designation as recip-
ient of the 2010 George Shiebler Award; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Kevin McGoff.
